newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Trees stolen for collectors, traced by microchip.
newsitem.headline: Trees stolen for collectors, traced by microchip.

text.p: Tree thieves who stole rare cycad plants for rich collectors failed to outsmart the hi-tech protection.

South Africa's Mpumalanga parks board said on Friday its officials and police from the Endangered Species Protection Unit had arrested a gang of three men who stole seven Lebomboensis cycads, which had been tagged with microchips.

The prized plants -- primitive, slow-growing species akin to the conifer but looking like stunted palms -- were seized at the homes of two collectors in the affluent northern suburbs of Johannesburg, along with 38 other plants that were all stolen from the Mananga Cycad Reserve in the east of the country.
